intro: Hapalochilus kelelensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian violet, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking violet and white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or rocky areas. Its leaves are usually ovate with a smooth texture, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
